text: (soft music)
- My name Shweta, and I'm working

as software development
manager in AWS Direct Connect.

So AWS Direct Connect is one
of the foundational services,
which the software engineering team,
basically is inventing solutions so

that customers can have
dedicated network access
from their premises to AWS cloud.
(upbeat music)
So what to expect when you come to Amazon?

I would say is do not come
with any preconceived notions,

because whatever you think
it would be beyond this,
like beyond your expectations.

I was moving after 13
years in one organization

this is what I perceive, this
is what I think it should be.
But it is way past the expectations
that I had and in a good way.
they give you the freedom of like, doing
and playing with your timing.

So it's up to you, how you
prioritize your work schedule.
There is no micromanagement as such,

that somebody's checking
when you start, when you end.
I have that work-life harmony.
I have kids like, it's in time with them.
(upbeat music)

Right now, we are hiring for
software development engineers
and system development engineers,
which is like, they confuse it,

that if you don't have
a networking experience
you might not be able to fit well.
But that's not the case, actually.
And you can take me as an example.
I'm absolute novice to networking.
I have spent like 18 years of my life
in healthcare insurance.
(upbeat music)

If you have software
development experience
you have the passion to build products
and you don't have any idea on networking,

don't shy away, because this
is the place you want to be.
